nodes.name: ReadCSV
nodes.description: It reads in CSV files and creates a DataFrame from it.
nodes.hint: Refresh the schema when a new file is selected or the file content has changed

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: path
fields.title: Path
fields.description: Path of the file/directory

fields.name: separator
fields.title: Separator
fields.description: CSV Separator

fields.name: header
fields.title: Header
fields.description: Whether the file has a header row

fields.name: dropSpecialCharacterInColumnName
fields.title: Drop Special Character In ColumnName
fields.description: Whether to drop the Special Characters and Spaces in Column Name.

fields.name: mode
fields.title: Mode
fields.description: Mode for dealing with corrupt records during parsing.

fields.name: enforceSchema
fields.title: Enforce Schema
fields.description: If it is set to true, the specified or inferred schema will be forcibly applied to datasource files, and headers in CSV files will be ignored. If the option is set to false, the schema will be validated against all headers in CSV files in the case when the header option is set to true.

fields.name: addInputFileName
fields.title: Whether to Add Input File Name as Column in the Dataframe
fields.description: Add the new field:input_file_name

fields.name: encoding
fields.title: Encoding
fields.description: Decodes the CSV files by the given encoding type

fields.name: quote
fields.title: Quote
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quoted values where the separator can be part of the value

fields.name: escape
fields.title: Escape
fields.description: Sets a single character used for escaping quotes inside an already quoted value.

fields.name: outputColNames
fields.title: Column Names for the CSV
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.name: outputColTypes
fields.title: Column Types for the CSV
fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.name: outputColFormats
fields.title: Column Formats for the CSV
fields.description: Format of the Output Columns

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: ds
fields.title: DS Column
fields.description: Date or DateTime variable

fields.name: y
fields.title: Y
fields.description: Target Variable

fields.name: growth
fields.title: Growth
fields.description: linear or logistic to specify a linear or logistic trend

fields.name: yearly_seasonality
fields.title: Yearly Seasonality
fields.description: Fit yearly seasonality.

fields.name: weekly_seasonality
fields.title: Weekly Seasonality
fields.description: Fit weekly seasonality.

fields.name: daily_seasonality
fields.title: Daily Seasonality
fields.description: Fit daily seasonality.

fields.name: seasonality_mode
fields.title: Seasonality Mode
fields.description: additive(default) or multiplicative

fields.name: interval_width
fields.title: Interval Width
fields.description: Float, width of the uncertainty intervals provided for the forecast

fields.name: changepoints
fields.title: Changepoints
fields.description: List of dates at which to include potential changepoints. If not specified, potential changepoints are selected automatically.

fields.name: changepoints_format
fields.title: Changepoints Format
fields.description: datetime format for the comma seperated Changepoint specified.

fields.name: n_changepoints
fields.title: N Changepoints
fields.description: Number of potential changepoints to include. Not used if input `changepoints` is supplied. If `changepoints` is not supplied, then n_changepoints potential changepoints are selected uniformly from the first `changepoint_range` proportion of the history.

fields.name: changepoint_range
fields.title: Changepoint Range
fields.description: Proportion of history in which trend changepoints will be estimated. Defaults to 0.8 for the first 80%. Not used if `changepoints` is specified.

fields.name: seasonality_prior_scale
fields.title: Seasonality Prior Scale
fields.description: Parameter modulating the strength of the seasonality model. Larger values allow the model to fit larger seasonal fluctuations, smaller values dampen the seasonality.

fields.name: holidays_prior_scale
fields.title: Holidays Prior Scale
fields.description: Parameter modulating the strength of the holiday components model, unless overridden in the holidays input. changepoint_prior_scale: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints.

fields.name: changepoint_prior_scale
fields.title: Changepoint Prior Scale
fields.description: Parameter modulating the flexibility of the automatic changepoint selection. Large values will allow many changepoints, small values will allow few changepoints.

fields.name: mcmc_samples
fields.title: mcmc samples
fields.description: Integer, if greater than 0, will do full Bayesian inference with the specified number of MCMC samples. If 0, will do MAP estimation.

fields.name: uncertainty_samples
fields.title: Uncertainty Samples
fields.description: Number of simulated draws used to estimate uncertainty intervals. Settings this value to 0 or False will disable uncertainty estimation and speed up the calculation.

fields.name: custom_seasonality
fields.title: Custom Seasonality
fields.description: Add a seasonal component with specified period, number of Fourier components, and prior scale. Input will be of form name=monthly,period=30.5,fourier_order=5,prior_scale=0.9(optional),mode=additive(optional).

fields.name: regressor
fields.title: Regressor
fields.description: Add an additional regressor to be used for fitting and predicting. Input will be of form name=column_name1,prior_scale=30.5(optional),standardize=auto(optional),mode=additive(optional):name=column_name2,prior_scale=40.5(optional),standardize=auto(optional),mode=additive(optional)

fields.name: country_holidays
fields.title: Country Holidays
fields.description: Built-in country holidays can only be set for a single country. Takes country as input like US

fields.name: height
fields.title: Height
fields.description: Height of note

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
Air Passengers Forecasting


Objective: Train a prophet univariate model to forecast the demand(passenger traffic) in Airplanes.

Dataset: This dataset provides monthly totals of a US airline passengers from 1949 to 1960. This dataset is taken from an open source dataset called AirPassengers.


Approach:

  1. Read the data.
  2. Create a dataframe with holiday list and pass it the prophet model
  3. Train a prophet model.
  4. Create the future dataframe for 24 months following the train data ie: from Jan 1961 to Dec 1962.
  5. Predict the air traffic for the duration.
fields.title: Comment
fields.description: Comments for the Workflow

fields.description: Any valid frequency for pd.date_range, such as 'D' or 'M'.

fields.name: include_history
fields.title: Include History
fields.description: Boolean to include the historical dates in the dataframe for predictions

nodes.name: PySpark
nodes.description: This node runs any given PySpark code. The input dataframe is passed into the function myfn as a parameter.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: code
fields.value:
'''
Input:
  spark: spark session 
  workflowContext:  workflowcontext object 
  id: node number 
  inDF: input pyspark dataframe 
  cust_dict: Dictionary of the workflow variables passed from previous node 
Output:
  outDF: return pyspark dataframe i.e outDF 
 ''' 
 
from pyspark.sql.types import * 
from pyspark.sql.functions import * 
from pyspark.sql import * 
from fire.workflowcontext import WorkflowContext 
import pandas as pd

def myfn(spark: SparkSession, workflowContext: WorkflowContext, id: int, inDF: DataFrame, cust_dict:dict):
   COVID = pd.DataFrame({'holiday': 'COVID','ds': pd.to_datetime(['2020-03-15']),'lower_window': -15,'upper_window': 15})
   spark_dataframe = spark.createDataFrame(COVID)
   return spark_dataframe
fields.title: PySpark
fields.description: PySpark code to be run. Input dataframe : "inDF", SparkContext : "sc", SQLContext : "sqlContext",  Output/Result dataframe should be registered as a temporary table - df.registerTempTable("outDF")

fields.title: Column Names
fields.description: New Output Columns of the SQL

fields.description: Data Type of the Output Columns

fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: horizon
fields.title: Horizon
fields.description: String with pd.Timedelta compatible style, e.g., '5 days','3 hours', '10 seconds'.

fields.name: period
fields.title: Period
fields.description: String with pd.Timedelta compatible style. Simulated forecast will be done at every this period. If not provided, 0.5 * horizon is used.

fields.name: initial
fields.title: Initial
fields.description: String with pd.Timedelta compatible style. The first training period will include at least this much data. If not provided,3 * horizon is used.

fields.name: cutoffs
fields.title: Cutoffs
fields.description: list of pd.Timestamp specifying cutoffs to be used during cross validation. If not provided, they are generated as described above.
